member.summary: Reads preference settings from input file and deserializes it into PreferenceSettings object This function can be overridden by version specific migrator classes
member.returns: returns the deserialized preference settings

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.MigrateFrom(Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase)
member.summary: Migrates preference settings, customized migration step in derived class. from source migrator version to current version. This function can be overridden by version specific migrator classes
member.param: source migrator version from which to migrate from
member.returns: new migrator instance after migration

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.MigrateBetweenDynamoVersions(Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathManager,Dynamo.Updates.IDynamoLookUp)
member.summary: Migrates preference settings and copies packages and custom node definitions from the last but one version to the currently installed Dynamo version
member.returns: new migrator instance after migration

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.GetLatestVersionToMigrate(Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathManager,Dynamo.Updates.IDynamoLookUp,Dynamo.Core.FileVersion)
member.summary: Returns the most recent version to migrate to the given current version.
member.returns: FileVersion?

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.GetInstalledVersions(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a list of file version objects given a root folder. Assuming the following folders exist:
e:\some\path\0.4 e:\some\path\0.75 e:\some\path\1.82
Calling this method with "e:\\some\\path" would return an ordered list in the following way (from largest number to smallest number):
{ FileVersion(1, 82), FileVersion(0, 75), FileVersion(0, 4) }
member.param: The root folder under which versioned sub- folders are expected to be found. This argument must represent a valid local directory.
member.returns: Return a list of FileVersion objects, ordered by newest version to the oldest version. If no versioned sub-folder exists, then the returned list is empty.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if rootFolder is null or an empty string.
This exception is thrown if rootFolder points to an invalid directory.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.GetInstalledVersions(Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathManager,Dynamo.Updates.IDynamoLookUp)
member.summary: Returns list of FileVersion objects, given the IPathManager and IDynamoLookUp objects. If a valid IDynamoLookUp interface object is passed, this method uses the lookup to get Dynamo user data locations.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.GetInstallVersionFromUserDataFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Returns FileVersion object of the Dynamo installation from the given user data folder path. Returns default(FileVersion) if file version can't be determined from the given folder path.
member.returns: A valid or default FileVersion object

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.Migrate(Dynamo.Core.FileVersion,Dynamo.Core.FileVersion)
member.summary: Given a root user data directory, this migrates user preferences, packages and custom node definition files from one installed version into another
member.param: source Dynamo version from which to migrate
target Dynamo version into which to migrate
member.returns: new migrator instance after migration, null if there's no migration

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.DynamoMigratorBase.CreateMigrator(Dynamo.Core.FileVersion)
member.summary: Given a FileVersion, this creates an instance of the migrator depending on the input version using reflection. Returns the default migrator (DynamoMigratorBase) if version specific migrator does not exist
member.param: input version for which migrator instance is created
member.returns: instance of migrator specific to input version.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.PathManager.ResolveLibraryPath(System.String@)
member.summary:
Given an initial file path with the file name, resolve the full path to the target file. The search happens in the following order:
1. If the provided file path is valid and points to an existing file, the file path is return as-is. 2. The file is searched alongside DynamoCore.dll for a match. 3. The file is searched within AdditionalResolutionPaths. 4. The search is left to system path resolution.
member.returns: Returns true if the requested file can be located, or false otherwise.

member.param: Parameters to configure the new instance of PathManager. See PathManagerParams for details of each field.

member.name: T:Dynamo.Core.IUndoRedoRecorderClient
member.summary: An instance of UndoRedoRecorder is owned by an "undo client" object. In the context of Dynamo, the undo client is "Workspace". The undo recorder calls into the owning undo client in an undo/redo operation, causing the client to delete, reload or create the corresponding model. To qualify as an undo client, a class must implement this interface.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.IUndoRedoRecorderClient.DeleteModel(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: UndoRedoRecorder calls this method to delete a model in the client.
member.param: The data representing the model to be deleted. It is important that this element contains identifiable information so that the corresponding model can be located in the client for deletion.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.IUndoRedoRecorderClient.ReloadModel(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: UndoRedoRecorder calls this method to request the client to reload a given model by giving its data.
member.param: The xml data from which the corresponding model can be reloaded from.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.IUndoRedoRecorderClient.CreateModel(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: UndoRedoRecorder calls this method to request a model to be created.
member.param: The xml data from which the corresponding model can be re-created from.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.IUndoRedoRecorderClient.GetModelForElement(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: UndoRedoRecorder calls this method to retrieve the up-to-date instance of the model before any undo/redo operation modifies the model. The up-to-date information of the model is important so that an undo operation can be redone (repopulated with the up-to-date data before the undo operation happens).
member.param: The xml data representing the model which UndoRedoRecorder requires for serialization purposes.
member.returns: Returns the model that modelData corresponds to.

summary.para: For a series of actions to be recorded for undo, an "action group" needs to be opened. An action group is the smallest unit in which undo or redo can be done. For example, dragging a set of nodes on the UI results in those nodes getting recorded in a single action group, when undo is done, the set of recorded nodes get reverted in one undo command.

It is mandatory for the caller of this method to call EndActionGroup when the undo recording is done for the current action group. Failing to do so will result in subsequent calls to BeginActionGroup to throw an exception.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.EndActionGroup
member.summary: Call this method to close the currently opened action group, wrapping all recorded actions as part of the group. Actions in an action group get undone/redone at one go with a single undo/redo command.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.Clear
member.summary: Call this method to clear the internal undo/redo stacks, effectively destroying all the recorded actions. This is desirable for example, when the workspace is cleared to be used as a clean slate for future works, causing recorded actions become irrelevant.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.RecordCreationForUndo(Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase)
member.summary: Record the given model right after it has been created. This results in a creation action to be recorded under the current action group. Undoing this action will result in the model being deleted.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.RecordDeletionForUndo(Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase)
member.summary: Record the given model right before it has been deleted. This results in a deletion action to be recorded under the current action group. Undoing this action will result in the model being created and re-inserted into the current workspace.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.RecordModificationForUndo(Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase)
member.summary: Record the given model right before it is modified. This results in a modification action to be recorded under the current action group. Undoing this action will result in the model being reverted to the states that it was in before the modification took place.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.PopFromUndoGroup
member.summary: This function removes the top most item from the UndoStack. In order to preserve continuity of both undo and redo stacks, a pop action cannot be done when undo has unwinded some user actions, leaving them on the redo stack. This partially helps making sure the method is only called when the caller recognizes the most recent item that was pushed onto the undo stack (and that it does not accidentally pop an action that is irrelevant).
member.returns: Returns the XmlElement representing the action group that is on top of the stack at the time pop is requested.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.EnsureValidRecorderStates
member.summary: This method is called at the beginning of any method that requires any existing undo group to be closed before proceeding. For example, UndoRedoRecorder.OpenGroup cannot be called again while there is an existing undo group that is left open.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder.IsRecordedInActionGroup(System.Xml.XmlElement,Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase)
member.summary: The recorder calls this method to determine if a given model has already been recorded in the active action group. For an example, if there is a connection between NodeA and NodeB, selecting both the nodes and deleting them will cause the connection model to be recorded twice (when a node is deleted, its connections are being recorded for undo).
member.param: The action group to check against.
member.returns: Returns true if the model has already been recorded in the current action group, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeLoaders.NodeFactory.CreateProxyNodeInstance(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A proxy custom node is a custom node without its definition loaded in Dynamo. The creation of a proxy custom node relies on information provided by the caller since the definition is not readily available for reading. The actual definition may become available at a later time by means of user uploading the definition.
member.param: Identifier of the custom node instance.
The functionId represents the GUID of the custom node definition that is used for creating the custom node instance.
The display name of the custom node.
member.returns: Returns the custom node instance if creation was successful, or null otherwise.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.CodeBlockUtils.GetStatementVariablesForOutports(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Statement})
member.summary: Call this method to get a list of lists of variables defined in the given set of Statement objects. This method is typically used in conjunction with DoesStatementRequireOutputPort method.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.CodeBlockUtils.DoesStatementRequireOutputPort(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String}},System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks wheter an outport is required for a Statement with the given index. An outport is not required if there are no defined variables or if any of the defined variables have been declared again later on in the same code block.
member.param: A list of lists, each of which contains variables defined by a Statement at the index. This list can be obtained from calling GetStatementVariables method.
The index of the Statement for which this call is made.
member.returns: Returns true if an output port is required, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.CodeBlockUtils.FormatUserText(System.String)
member.summary:
Call this method to format user codes in the following ways:
1. Leading and trailing whitespaces are removed from the original string. Characters that qualify as "whitespaces" are: '\n', '\t' and ' '.
2. Multiple statements on a single line will be broken down further into multiple statements. For example, "a = 1; b = 2;" will be broken down into two lines: "a = 1;\nb = 2;" (line break denoted by the new \n character).
3. Leading whitespaces will be removed ony for the first line. This is to preserve the indentation for lines other than the first.
4. If the resulting codes do not end with a closing curly bracket '}', then a semi-colon is appended to the code. This ensures codes like "a" will result in codes becoming "a;"
member.param: Original code content as typed in by the user.
member.returns: Returns the formatted code with the above process.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.CodeBlockUtils.GetDefinitionLineIndexMap(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Statement})
member.summary: Returns a list of defined variables, along with the line number on which they are defined last. A variable can be defined multiple times in a single code block node, but the output port is only shown on the last definition.
member.returns: Returns a map between defined variables and the line index on which they are defined last.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Utilities.PreprocessTypeName(System.String)

summary.para: This method patches the fullyQualifiedName of a given type. It updates the given name to its newer form (i.e. "Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Xyz") if it matches the older form (e.g. "Dynamo.Elements.Xyz").
The method also attempts to update "XYZ/UV" convention to "Xyz/Uv" to comply with the new Dynamo naming convention.

member.param: A fully qualified name. An example of this would be "Dynamo.Elements.dynNode".
member.returns: The processed fully qualified name. For an example, the name "Dynamo.Elements.UV" will be returned as "Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Uv".

member.summary: This method returns a name for the icon based on name of the node.
member.param: Function descriptor, that contains all info about node.
overridePrefix is used as default value for generating node icon name. If overridePrefix is empty, it uses QualifiedName property. e.g. Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.CoordinateSystem.ByOrigin

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Utilities.ShortenCategoryName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns formatted category name replacing delimeters and if category is too long leaving only first and last subcategories.
member.param: Full category name including all parent categories up to root one.
member.returns: Formatted category name.

member.summary: Call this method to associate/remove the target file path with/from the given XmlDocument object.
member.param: The XmlDocument with which the target file path is to be associated. This parameter cannot be null.
The target file path to be associated with the given XmlDocument. If this parameter is null or an empty string, then any target file path that was previously associated will be removed.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Utilities.GetDocumentXmlPath(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Call this method to retrieve the associated target file path from the given XmlDocument object. An exception will be thrown if such target file path was never associated with the XmlDocument object.

member.returns: Returns the associated target file path.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Utilities.LoadTraceDataFromXmlDocument(System.Xml.XmlDocument)

member.param: The XmlDocument from which serialized node- data-list pairs are to be deserialized.
member.returns: Returns a dictionary of deserialized node-data-list pairs loaded from the given XmlDocument.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Utilities.MakeRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to compute the relative path of a subject path relative to the given base path.
member.param: The base path which relative path is to be computed from. This base path does not need to point to a valid file on disk, but it cannot be an empty string.
The subject path of which the relative path is to be computed. If this path is not empty but does not represent a valid path string, a UriFormatException is thrown.
member.returns: Returns the path of the subject relative to the given base path.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.Utilities.MakeAbsolutePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to form the absolute path to target pointed to by relativePath parameter. The absolute path is formed by computing both base path and the relative path.
member.param: The base path from which the absolute path is to be computed. This argument cannot be null or empty.
The relative path to the target. This argument cannot be null or empty.
member.returns: Returns the absolute path.

member.summary: Output nodes are used by applications that consume graphs outside of Dynamo such as Optioneering, Optimization, and Dynamo Player. Output nodes can be any node that returns a single output or a dictionary. Code block nodes and Custom nodes are specifically excluded at this time even though they can return a single output for sake of clarity.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel.CachedValue
member.summary:
The value of this node after the most recent computation
As this property could be modified by the virtual machine, it's dangerous to access this value without using the active Scheduler. Use the Scheduler to remove the possibility of race conditions.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel.WasInvolvedInExecution
member.summary: This flag is used to determine if a node was involved in a recent execution. The primary purpose of this flag is to determine if the node's render packages should be returned to client browser when it requests for them. This is mainly to avoid returning redundant data that has not changed during an execution.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel.WasRenderPackageUpdatedAfterExecution
member.summary: This flag indicates if render packages of a NodeModel has been updated since the last execution. UpdateRenderPackageAsyncTask will always be generated for a NodeModel that took part in the evaluation, if this flag is false.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel.ComputeUpstreamOnDownstreamNodes
member.summary: For a given node, this function computes all the upstream nodes by gathering the cached upstream nodes on this node's immediate parents. If a node has any downstream nodes, then for all those downstream nodes, upstream nodes will be computed. Essentially this method propogates the UpstreamCache down. Also this function gets called only after the workspace is added.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel.GetPortVerticalOffset(Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.PortModel)
member.summary:
If a "PortModel.LineIndex" property isn't "-1", then it is a PortModel meant to match up with a line in code block node. A code block node may contain empty lines in it, resulting in one PortModel being spaced out from another one. In such cases, the vertical position of PortModel is dependent of its "LineIndex".
If a "PortModel.LineIndex" property is "-1", then it is a regular PortModel. Regular PortModel stacks up on one another with equal spacing, so their positions are based solely on "PortModel.Index".
member.param: The portModel whose vertical offset is to be computed.
member.returns: Returns the offset of the given port from the top of the ports

member.name: T:Dynamo.Graph.Workspaces.ConnectorConverter
member.summary: The ConnectorConverter is used to serialize and deserialize ConnectorModels. The Start and End of a ConnectorModel are references to PortModels, but we want the serialized representation of a Connector to reference these ports by Id. This converter resolves the reference to the correct NodeModel instance by id, and constructs the ConnectorModel.

member.summary: Returns the current UndoRedoRecorder that is associated with the current WorkspaceModel. Note that external parties should not have the needs to access the recorder directly, so this property is exposed just as a "temporary solution". Before using this property, consider using WorkspaceModel.RecordModelsForUndo method which allows for multiple modifications in a single action group.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Workspaces.WorkspaceModel.RecordModelsForModification(System.Collections.Generic.List{Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase},Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder)
member.summary: TODO(Ben): This method is exposed this way for external codes (e.g. the DragCanvas) to record models before they are modified. This is by no means ideal. The ideal case of course is for ALL codes that end up modifying models to be folded back into WorkspaceViewModel in the form of commands. These commands then internally record those affected models before updating them. We need this method to be gone sooner than later.
member.param: The models to be recorded for undo.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.Workspaces.WorkspaceModel.SetModelEventOnAnnotation
member.summary: this sets the event on Annotation. This event return the model from the workspace. When a model is ungrouped from a group, that model will be deleted from that group. So, when UNDO execution, cannot get that model from that group, it has to get from the workspace. The below method will set the event on every annotation model, that will return the specific model from workspace.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase.HandleModelEvent(System.String,System.Int32,Dynamo.Core.UndoRedoRecorder)
member.summary: This method is currently used as a way to send an event to ModelBase derived objects. Its primary use is in DynamoNodeButton class, which sends this event when clicked, to change the number of ports in a VariableInputNode.
member.param: For the SetInPortCount event, the number of ports desired. Ignored for other events.
member.returns: Returns true if the call has been handled, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Graph.ModelBase.UpdateValueCore(Dynamo.Graph.UpdateValueParams)
member.summary: This method is supplied as a generic way for command framework to update a given named-value in a ModelBase (which has to work under both user and playback scenarios). During playback, the command framework issues pre-recorded UpdateModelValueCommand that targets a model. Since there is no data-binding at play here, there will not be IValueConverter. This method takes only string input (the way they appear in DynamoTextBox), which overridden method can use for value conversion.
member.returns: Returns true if the call has been handled, or false otherwise.

member.name: T:Dynamo.Scheduler.UpdateRenderPackageAsyncTask
member.summary: An asynchronous task to regenerate render packages for a given node. During execution the task retrieves the corresponding IGraphicItem from EngineController through a set of drawable identifiers supplied by the node. These IGraphicItem objects then fill the IRenderPackage objects with tessellated geometric data. Each of the resulting IRenderPackage objects is then tagged with a label.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.Priority
member.summary: DynamoScheduler sorts tasks based on two key factors: the priority of a task, and the relative importance between two tasks that have the same priority. During task re-prioritizing process, DynamoScheduler first sorts the tasks in accordance to their AsyncTask.Priority property. The resulting ordered list is then sorted again by calling AsyncTask.Compare method to determine the relative importance among tasks having the same priority.

member.name: E:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.Completed
member.summary: This event is raised when the AsyncTask is completed, in the context of ISchedulerThread, any UI element access that is needed should be dispatched onto the UI dispatcher.

member.summary: Raised if the AsyncTask is discarded by an IScheduler and will not be executed

member.summary: Constructs an instance of AsyncTask object.
member.param: A reference to the DynamoScheduler, this parameter cannot be null.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.MarkTaskAsScheduled
member.summary: This method is invoked when DynamoScheduler places this AsyncTask into its internal task queue. This method is only meant to be used internally by the DynamoScheduler.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.CanMergeWith(Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask)
member.summary: This method is called by DynamoScheduler when it compacts the task queue. The result of this call indicates if either of the tasks in comparison should be dropped from the task queue, or both should be kept. Tasks that are discarded during this phase will not be executed.
member.returns: Returns the comparison result. See Comparison enumeration for details of the possible values.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.Compare(Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask)
member.summary: Call this method to determine the relative priority of two AsyncTask objects. DynamoScheduler makes use of this method to determine the order in which AsyncTask objects are sorted in its internal task queue.
member.param: A task to compare this task with.
member.returns: Returns -1 if this AsyncTask object should be processed before the other AsyncTask; returns 1 if this AsyncTask object should be processed after the other AsyncTask; or 0 if both AsyncTask objects have the same priority and can be processed in the current order.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.Execute
member.summary: This method is called when the SchedulerThread decides to execute a scheduled AsyncTask in the task queue. Derived tasks overrides ExecuteCore method to perform relevant operations. This method is invoked in the context of the SchedulerThread and not the main thread.
member.returns: Returns true if execution was successful, or false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.AsyncTask.HandleTaskCompletion
member.summary: This method is called by DynamoScheduler after AsyncTask.Execute method returns. It is guaranteed to be called even when exception is thrown from within AsyncTask.Execute.

member.summary: AsyncTask base class calls this to obtain the new time-stamp value.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.IScheduler.ProcessNextTask(System.Boolean)
member.summary: An ISchedulerThread implementation calls this method so scheduler starts to process the next task in the queue, if there is any. Note that this method is meant to process only one task in queue. The implementation of ISchedulerThread is free to call this method again in a fashion that matches its task fetching behavior.
member.param: This parameter is only used if the task queue is empty at the time this method is invoked. When the task queue becomes empty, setting this to true will cause this call to block until either the next task becomes available, or when the scheduler is requested to shutdown.
member.returns: This method returns true if the task queue is not empty, or false otherwise. Note that this method returns false when scheduler begins to shutdown, even when the task queue is not empty.

member.summary: This class represents Dynamo scheduler. All the tasks are scheduled on the scheduler. Also, these tasks runs async.

member.name: E:Dynamo.Scheduler.DynamoScheduler.TaskStateChanged
member.summary: Event that is raised when the state of an AsyncTask is changed. The state of an AsyncTask changes when it is scheduled, discarded, executed or completed. Note that this event is raised in the context of ISchedulerThread, any access to UI components or collections in WorkspaceModel (e.g. Nodes, Connectors, etc.) should be dispatched for execution on the UI thread.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Scheduler.DynamoScheduler.NextTimeStamp
member.summary: AsyncTask base class calls this to obtain the new time-stamp value.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.DynamoScheduler.Shutdown
member.summary: Call this method to properly shutdown the scheduler and its associated ISchedulerThread. This call will be blocked until the ISchedulerThread terminates. Note that the implementation of ISchedulerThread may or may not choose to handle all the remaining AsyncTask in queue when shutdown happens -- DynamoScheduler ensures the tasks in queue are cleared when this call returns.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.DynamoScheduler.ProcessNextTask(System.Boolean)
member.summary: An ISchedulerThread implementation calls this method so scheduler starts to process the next task in the queue, if there is any. Note that this method is meant to process only one task in queue. The implementation of ISchedulerThread is free to call this method again in a fashion that matches its task fetching behavior.
member.param: This parameter is only used if the task queue is empty at the time this method is invoked. When the task queue becomes empty, setting this to true will cause this call to block until either the next task becomes available, or when the scheduler is requested to shutdown.
member.returns: This method returns true if the task queue is not empty, or false otherwise. Note that this method returns false when scheduler begins to shutdown, even when the task queue is not empty.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Scheduler.DynamoScheduler.HasPendingTasks
member.summary: Returns true if task queue is not empty.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Scheduler.DynamoScheduler.CompactTaskQueue
member.summary: This method is called when ISchedulerThread calls ProcessNextTask method to process next available task in queue. It is only called if the task queue was updated (one or more AsyncTask scheduled) before ISchedulerThread picks up the next task.
member.returns: Returns a list of AsyncTask objects that were dropped, if any, during task queue compact. The return list can be empty but it will never be null.

member.summary: This method is called by task creator to associate the trace data with the current instance of virtual machine. The given WorkspaceModel can optionally contain saved trace data in a previous execution session. As a side-effect, this method resets "WorkspaceModel.PreloadedTraceData" data member to ensure the correctness of the execution flow.
member.param: Reference to the EngineController on which the loaded trace data should be set.
The workspace from which the trace data should be retrieved.
member.returns: If the given WorkspaceModel contains saved trace data, this method returns true, in which case the task needs to be scheduled. Otherwise, the method returns false.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.CodeGeneration.AstBuilder.TopologicalSort(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel})
member.summary: Sort nodes in topological order.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.CodeGeneration.AstBuilder.BfsTraverse(Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel,Dynamo.Engine.CodeGeneration.AstBuilder.MarkFlag},System.Collections.Generic.Queue{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel})
member.summary: Starts from the input node as root, do breadth-first and post-order traversal of the graph (inputs nodes as children nodes). Breadth-first traversal ensures all inputs nodes are visited in their input order and post-order traversal ensures all upstream nodes are visited firstly.
member.param: Dictionary to record if a node has been visited or not

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.CodeGeneration.AstBuilder.TopologicalSortForGraph(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel})
member.summary:
Topological sort *the whole graph*. If the input nodes are part of a graph, it does not promise to generate a good topological order. For example, for the following graph:
+---+ | A | -----+ +---+ +----> +---+ | C | +----> +---+ +---+ | | B | -----+ +---+
Their ideal topological order is A -> B -> C. If the input is only {A, B}, it may return {B, A} which is not OK in node to code.
Note it is much slower than TopologicalSort().

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.CodeGeneration.AstBuilder.CompileToAstNodes(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel},Dynamo.Engine.CodeGeneration.CompilationContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compile a collection of NodeModel to AST nodes in different contexts. If the context is ForNodeToCode, nodes should already be sorted in topological order.
Compiles a collection of Dynamo nodes into a function definition for a custom node.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.EngineController.ProcessPendingCustomNodeSyncData(Dynamo.Scheduler.IScheduler)
member.summary: DynamoModel calls this method prior to scheduling a graph update for the home workspace. This method is called to schedule custom node compilation since the home workspace update may depend on it. member.name: T:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.TypeDependentNameGenetrator

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.GetCliques(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel})
member.summary: For a selection, output partitions that each group of node can be converted to code.

Collect input, output and renaming maps.
Inputs are input variables from external node models, finally shorter names will be given for these inputs. Note when the function returns, values in inputMap are always empty strings.
Outputs are variables that output to external node models. Shorter names will be given for these outupts. But if outputs are from code block node, as variables may be re-named during variable numbering, we can't simply record orignal output variable names. So when function returns, if a variable is from output port of non code block node, there is an entry:
outputMap[var_node_model_guid] = ""
If a variable, say "foo", is from code block node, there are two entries:
outputMap[foo_node_model_guid] = "foo" outputMap[foo%node_model_guid] = foo_node_model_guid
We need second entry because because finally we will use outputMap to restore the connection, and if "foo" is renamed to something else, say "foo21", we can find the value of key from the second entry and update the first entry to:
outputMap[foo_ndoe_mode_guid] = "foo21".
Renaming map are similar to output map. The difference is these variables used internally and they may be renamed as well. In some sense, it is just subset of outputMap.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.IsTempVarFromCodeBlockNode(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Check if this identifier is a temporary variable that output from other code block node.
Renumber variables used in astNode.
Remap variables.
Map variable to shorter name.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.GetNextShortName(Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.TypeDependentNameGenetrator,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,ProtoCore.Type},System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Returns type-dependent short name based on the type hint of input variable

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.ConstantPropagationForTemp(Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeResult,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Remove temporary assignment from the result. That is, removing assignment "t1 = x" where t1 is a temporary variable. This kind of assginment can be safely removed, but now all nodes that connect to "t1" should re-connect to "x". For example, "a = t1" now should be updated to "a = x".

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.ReplaceWithShortestQualifiedName(ProtoCore.DSASM.ClassTable,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ProtoCore.AST.AssociativeAST.AssociativeNode},ProtoCore.Namespace.ElementResolver)
member.summary:
Replace fully qualified class name with shortest uniquely qualified name.
For example, in presence of Rhino.Geometry.Point, replace
Autodesk.Geometry.Point.ByCoordinates(...)
with
Autodesk.Point.ByCoordinates(...)

member.name: M:Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.NodeToCodeCompiler.NodeToCode(ProtoCore.Core,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.NodeModel},Dynamo.Engine.NodeToCode.INamingProvider)
member.summary:
Compile a set of nodes to ASTs.
Note: 1. Nodes should be a clique with regarding to convertibility and selection state. That is, these nodes can be safely to be converted into a single code block node. It shouldn't have unconvertible or unselected node on any path (if there is) that connects any two of these nodes, otherwise there will be circular references between unconvertible/unselected node and code block node.
To split arbitary node set into cliques, use NodeToCodeUtils.GetCliques().
2. WorkspaceNodes are all nodes in current workspace. We need the whole graph so that each to-be-converted node will have correct order in the final code block node.
member.param: Selected node that can be converted to a single code block node

member.name: T:Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathResolver
member.summary: This interface provides paths to external assemblies and node directories.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathResolver.AdditionalResolutionPaths
member.summary: Additional directories that should be considered when path resolution is done for a library that does not contain full path information. The return value of this property should never be null. Each entry must represent a valid directory, otherwise DirectoryNotFoundException exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathResolver.AdditionalNodeDirectories
member.summary: Additional directories in which node assemblies can be located. The return value of this property should never be null. Each entry must represent a valid directory, otherwise DirectoryNotFoundException exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathResolver.PreloadedLibraryPaths
member.summary: Libraries to be preloaded as part of Dynamo start up sequence. Each entry in this list can either represent full path to a library, or just the assembly name. If absolute path information is not supplied, the library will be looked up through both predefined and additional resolution paths. The return value of this property should never be null.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathResolver.UserDataRootFolder
member.summary: This property represents the root folder where user specific data files are stored. If this property returns a null or empty string, then PathManager falls back to using "%ProgramData%\Dynamo\Dynamo Core". If this property returns a string that does not represent an existing folder, PathManager will attempt to create a new directory. If the property does not represent a valid path string, an exception will be thrown by the underlying system IO API invoked. Note that this path should not include the version number as it will be appended by PathManager.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Interfaces.IPathResolver.CommonDataRootFolder
member.summary: This property represents the root folder where application common data files (i.e. shared among all users on the same machine) are stored. If this property returns a null or empty string, then PathManager falls back to using "%AppData%\Dynamo\Dynamo Core". If this property returns a string that does not represent an existing folder, PathManager will attempt to create a new directory. If the property does not represent a valid path string, an exception will be thrown by the underlying system IO API invoked. Note that this path should not include the version number as it will be appended by PathManager.

member.name: T:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel
member.summary: The core model of Dynamo.

member.name: T:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand
member.summary: This is the base class of all recordable commands. It provides the contract between a UI event handler (e.g. delegate command method or a button event handler) and the actual command handler in the DynamoViewModel. It is mandatory for each RecordableCommand-derived class to be serializable to/deserializable from an XmlElement.

member.name: F:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.jsonSettings
member.summary: Settings that is used for serializing commands

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.#cctor
member.summary: Initialize commands serializing settings

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of RecordableCommand derived class. This constructor is made protected to indicate that the class instance can only be instantiated through a derived class.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of RecordableCommand derived class, assigning a new tag to it.
member.param: A string tag to be assigned to the command. This parameter can be any string, even an empty one. However, it should not be null. A null "tag" parameter causes the ArgumentNullException to be thrown.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Execute(Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel)
member.summary: Call this method to execute a RecordableCommand. A RecordableCommand must be executed in the context of an existing DynamoViewModel.
member.param: The DynamoModel object this RecordableCommand is targeting.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Serialize(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: This method serializes the RecordableCommand object in the form of XmlElement for storage. The resulting XmlElement contains all the arguments that are required by this command.
member.param: The XmlDocument from which an XmlElement can be created.
member.returns: The XmlElement representation of this RecordableCommand object. It will be used in RecordableCommand.Deserialize method to completely reconstruct the RecordableCommand it represents.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Serialize
member.summary: This method serializes the RecordableCommand object in the json form. The resulting string contains command type name and all the arguments that are required by this command.
member.returns: The string can be used for reconstructing RecordableCommand using Deserialize method

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Deserialize(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Call this static method to reconstruct a RecordableCommand-derived object given an XmlElement that was previously saved with Serialize method. This method simply redirects the XmlElement to respective RecordableCommand-derived classes based on its type.
member.param: The XmlElement from which the RecordableCommand can be reconstructed.
member.returns: Returns the reconstructed RecordableCommand object. If a RecordableCommand cannot be reconstructed, this method throws a relevant exception.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Call this static method to reconstruct a RecordableCommand from json string that contains command name - name of corresponding class inherited from RecordableCommand, - and all the arguments that are required by this command.
member.param: Json string that contains command name and all its arguments.
member.returns: Reconstructed RecordableCommand

member.name: P:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Redundant
member.summary: Some commands are fired at high frequency (e.g. dragging and window selection related commands), and can be simulated during playback by issuing the final occurrence of the command. For example, window selection command is fired for each mouse-move event, but the end result will be same if only the final selection command is recorded. If this property is set to 'true', then only the last occurrence will be recorded for playback.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.IsInPlaybackMode
member.summary: This flag will be set to true only during playback. Derived classes can use this to decide their actions accordingly. For example, UpdateModelValueCommand doesn't change the value of a property during recording time, it is created for the sole purpose of being recorded. During playback, then UpdateModelValueCommand will update the property that it is bound to. This is a runtime flag, it is not serialized in anyway.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.Tag
member.summary: This is an optional tag for each of the recorded commands in a command Xml file. A command can only be tagged from within a command Xml file manually, and a tag is useful for unit test verification passes. See PlaybackStateChangedEventArgs class for possible usage of command tags. If a command is not tagged, its default tag value is an empty string.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.ExecuteCore(Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel)
member.summary: Derived classes must implement this method to perform the actual command execution. A typical implementation of this method involves calling a corresponding method on DynamoModel by passing itself as the only argument.
member.param: The DynamoModel object on which this command should be executed.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.SerializeCore(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Derived classes must implement this method to serialize all relevant information into the XmlElement supplied to it. Typically the method is a direct mirror of DeserializeCore.
member.param: All arguments that are required for this command are written into this XmlElement. The information written here must be exactly what DeserializeCore method expects.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.RecordableCommand.TrackAnalytics
member.summary: This method provides derived class implementation of analytics tracking, and only gets called if analytics tracking is enabled.

member.name: E:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.ShutdownStarted
member.summary: This event is raised right before the shutdown of DynamoModel started. When this event is raised, the shutdown is guaranteed to take place (i.e. user has had a chance to save the work and decided to proceed with shutting down Dynamo). Handlers of this event can still safely access the DynamoModel, the WorkspaceModel (along with its contents), and the DynamoScheduler.

member.name: E:Dynamo.Models.DynamoModel.ShutdownCompleted
member.summary: This event is raised after DynamoModel has been shut down. At this point the DynamoModel is no longer valid and access to it should be avoided.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Search.NodeSearchModel.ProcessNodeCategory(System.String,Dynamo.Search.SearchElements.SearchElementGroup@)
member.summary:
Call this method to assign a default grouping information if a given category does not have any. A node category's group can either be "Create", "Query" or "Actions". If none of the group names above is assigned to the category, it will be assigned a default one that is "Actions".
For examples:
"Core.Evaluate" will be renamed as "Core.Evaluate.Actions" "Core.List.Create" will remain as "Core.List.Create"

member.name: T:Dynamo.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed.
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.BackupOriginalFile(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Call this method to backup the DYN file specified by originalPath. The new file will be backed up to a location where Dynamo has write access to.
member.param: Path of the original DYN file to be backed up.
Path of the backed up file. This value will be a valid file path only if this method returns true.
member.returns: Returns true if the backup was successful, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.GetUniqueFileName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to get the unique backup file name within the given folder.
member.param: The folder where file search should happen.
The name of the original file which is to be backed-up. This argument should have an extension, although it is not mandatory.
member.returns: Returns the full path to a unique file name for the backup file.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.GetBackupFolder(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method with a root directory path information, and then a backup sub-directory will be created below it (if one does not already exist).
member.param: This is a directory inside which a new backup sub-directory will be created. If this parameter does not represent a valid directory name, an exception will be thrown.

Set this parameter to false if the creation of the backup sub-directory is not desired. Typically this means the method is called from within a test case and it is only interested in getting the resulting path back without actually creating a new backup sub-directory.
member.returns: Returns full path to the backup folder created.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.GetUniqueIndex(System.String[])
member.summary: Call this method to determine the next available backup file name from the given set of file names.
member.param: An array of file names, each in the form of 'FileName.NNN.backup'.
member.returns: Returns the next available index to use as backup file name

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.ExtractFileIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to extract the index of a backup file.
member.param: The file name of a backup file. This parameter must be in the form of 'FileName.NNN.backup', where 'NNN' is an integer value. The file name must also have a '*.backup' extension.
member.returns: Returns the integer equivalent of the backup file index 'NNN' if the call is successful.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.VersionFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Remove revision number from 'fileVersion' (so we get '0.6.3.0' instead of '0.6.3.20048'). This way all migration methods with 'NodeMigration.from' attribute value '0.6.3.xyz' can be used to migrate nodes in workspace version '0.6.3.ijk' (i.e. the revision number does not have to be exact match for a migration method to work).
member.param: The version string to convert into Version object. Valid examples include "0.6.3.0" and "0.6.3.20048".
member.returns: Returns the Version object representation of 'version' argument, except without the 'revision number'.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.VersionFromWorkspace(Dynamo.Graph.Workspaces.WorkspaceModel)
member.summary: Call this method to obtain the version of current WorkspaceModel. Note that the revision number is dropped as both "0.7.0.1234" should be treated as the same version as "0.7.0.5678", and no file migration should take place.
member.param: The WorkspaceModel to get the Version from.
member.returns: Returns the Version object representing the workspace version with the revision set to 0.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.ShouldMigrateFile(System.Version,System.Version,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method to determine if migration should take place for the input DYN/DYF file based on the given version numbers.
member.returns: Returns the decision if the migration should take place or not. See "Decision" enumeration for details of each field.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.CreateFunctionNodeFrom(System.Xml.XmlElement,System.String[])
member.summary: Call this method to create a XmlElement with a set of attributes carried over from the source XmlElement. The new XmlElement will have a name of "Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.ZeroTouch.DSFunction".
member.param: The list of attribute names whose values are to be carried over to the resulting XmlElement. This list is mandatory and it cannot be empty. If a specified attribute cannot be found in srcElement, an empty attribute with the same name will be created in the resulting XmlElement.
member.returns: Returns the resulting XmlElement with specified attributes duplicated from srcElement. The resulting XmlElement will also have a mandatory "type" attribute with value "Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.ZeroTouch.DSFunction".

member.returns: Returns the XmlElement that represents a custom node with its basic function information with default attributes.

member.name: M:Dynamo.Migration.MigrationManager.CreateFunctionNodeFrom(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Call this method to create a duplicated XmlElement with all the attributes found from the source XmlElement.
member.returns: Returns the duplicated XmlElement with all attributes found in the source XmlElement. The resulting XmlElement will also have a mandatory "type" attribute with value "Dynamo.Graph.Nodes.ZeroTouch.DSFunction".

member.summary: Call this method to retrieve the first connector given a port. This method is a near equivalent of FindConnectors, but only return the first connector found. member.summary: BaseVersion is a method which compares the current Dynamo Core Version and the HostVersion (DynamoRevit/DynamoStudio etc.) and returns the earlier (lower) Version. This allows subsequent methods to do a single check and if there is an updated version (to either Core/Host versions), the subsequent methods will poll the server for an update.

member.name: P:Dynamo.Properties.Resources.UsageReportingErrorMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Uh oh... We're sorry - we tried to save your decisions, but something went wrong. The decision probably hasn't been saved. This really shouldn't have happened. Please get in touch via GitHub and send us this information. You can also try deleting [FILEPATH] and trying again. Depending on your previous choice, instrumentation may still be running, if you're worried about this, please consider not using Dynamo until we've got back to you to solve the problem. Sorry about that..
